description: Finds a certain user by searching for a certain keyword through the user's environments "user-info/contact/company" and "user-info/contact/private". Additionally you may use FindUser to search for an exact username or a part of such one.
availability: All users have access to this command. The command only works if you are searching for your own subusers.

paramaters.Definition: Parameter by which the output will be sorted, must be one of the following: USERID, USERIDDESC, USERCREATEDDATE, USERCREATEDDATEDESC
Depth of the list, may be SELF, SUBUSER or ALL
USER: search for usernameENVIRONMENT: search through the enviroments mentioned aboveDefault value: USER
Flag to control if the search should match exactly or not; can be 0 or 1, DEFAULT: 0
The index of the first entry to be returned
Max. number of entries to be returned. The system has a default value for performance purposes
If INVERT = 1, all users are found which DO NOT include the search pattern
If set to 1: verbose output (more parameters)
Only search for active users if set to 1
